page.title: 15THE CUCKOO WALK, POLEGATE
page.content: WHEN THE CUCKOO RAILWAY LINE RUNNING FROM POLEGATE,NORTHWARDS TO LONDON VIA MANY SMALL E.SUSSEX AND KENT VILLAGES CLOSED @1969 IT BECAME A LOVELY WALK. THE{CUCKOO LINE} GOT ITS NAME FROM THE OLD CUCKOO FAIR HELD IN HEATHFIELD EVERY APRIL, WHERE A CUCKOO WAS RELEASED.THE RAILWAY LINE WAS OF GREAT BENEFIT TO THE AREA AND WAS GREATLY MISSED WHEN IT CLOSED. WHEN I WALKED DOWN THE CUCKOO WALK I SAW 2 DEAD SHREWS,LOTS OF WASPS, MAGPIES & PIGEONS.I HEARD A NIGHTING- GALE SINGING,A ROOK CROWING & A HOUSE MARTIN CATCHING A DRAGONFLY IN FLIGHT. ABOVE A BUSH AND ON A WIRE I SAW TWO KESTRELS.THERE ARE MANY BIRDS AROUND. AROUND THE WALK ARE FIELDS WITH LAMBS AND HORSES AND YOU CAN SEE THE OLD GATE AND RAILWAY CROSSING POSTS.I SAW LITS OF FLOWERS -HONEYSUCKLE,BUTTERCUP POPPIES,WILD ROSES,DAISIES,DANDELIONS.
